thread.title: Cambodia's state-run firm seeks to generate 6.4 mln in IPO
thread.title_full: Cambodia's state-run firm seeks to generate 6.4 mln in IPO | Khmer Times | News Portal Cambodia |

title: Cambodia's state-run firm seeks to generate 6.4 mln in IPO
text:
PHNOM PENH, (Xinhua) -- The state enterprise that operates Cambodia's second-largest port is looking to raise up to 6.4 million U.S. dollars in its initial public offering (IPO) and float 20 percent of its shares on the stock market in December.
The Phnom Penh Autonomous Port (PPAP) will issue a total of 4.1 million shares at a price to be fixed following a three-day book- building session scheduled to begin on Oct. 19.
Yuanta Securities, the underwriter for the IPO, has set the price band from 4,405 riel to 6,320 riel (approximately 1.08 U.S. dollars to 1.55 U.S. dollars) per share. With that, the PPAP expects the proceeds from the share offering to be between 4.4 million U.S. dollars and 6.4 million U.S. dollars.
Upon completion of the book building, the PPAP and its underwriter will set the price at which shares will be sold to investors. The subscription period will run from Nov. 12 to 17 ahead of the listing on the Cambodia Securities Exchange, scheduled for Dec. 11, according to the company prospectus.
The PPAP has almost doubled its total capacity to 300,000 twenty-foot-equivalent units per year since 2013 after it built a new container terminal under China's concessional loan.
